channel.title: Help me plz! With portforwarding [read plz]
channel.description:
I need help at port forwarding... i have a BT HomeHub, and i have done most of the things from http://www.portforward.com/english/routers/port_forwarding/BT/BTHomeHub/default.htm just the last bits, such as creating a new game or application, ive done what they said on this ^^ but i do not know what to put in protocol, port range from ####-#### , translate to , trigger protocol
Please help me asap!
[IMG]http://i191.photobucket.com/albums/z131/Darkness_Pk/elp.jpg[/img]
[size=30pt][b] PLZ HELP IM ON THIS PART AND IF WHAT YOU SAY WORKS, YOULL BE ADMIN ON IT ;)[/b][/size]
omfg i did all it said, made it so that it triggered, turned on no-ip, and turned all the appplication things on and still it says "The server [cant say incase of leech] is offline, it must be online before you can register it here. Hits Since 8-23-06 "

and still it says

Hits Since 8-23-06 "

then can u add me kyle ? Blueprint_rules@hotmail.com

helppppp plz

Read full topic
item.source: Help me plz! With portforwarding [read plz]

item.title: Help me plz! With portforwarding [read plz]
item.dc:creator: @kyledibiase kyledibiase
item.description:
@kyledibiase wrote:

almost all of it but thats about half of it[quote=“Darque Star, post:9, topic:156549”]Open a web browser like internet explorer or Netscape. Enter the ip address of your router in the address bar of your browser. In the picture above the address bar has http://www.google.com in it. Just replace all of that with the ip address of your router. By default the ip address should be set to 192.168.1.254.

You should see a box prompting you for your username and password. Enter your username and password now. By default both the username and password are admin. Click the Ok button to log in to your router.

Click the Advanced link near the left side of the page.

Click the Continue to Advanced link near the center of the page.

The menu on the left should change. In this new menu, click Application Sharing.

Click the click here link near the center of the page.

Enter the name of the program into the Name box. It doesn’t really matter what you put into this box, but something that will remind you why these ports are being forwarded would be a good idea. Put a dot into the Manual Entry of Port Maps radio button. Click the Next button.

Use the Protocol drop down box to select the protocol type of the ports you are forwarding. If you are forwarding a single port, enter that port number into the Translate To, top Port Range and the bottom Port Range boxes. If you are forwarding a range of ports, enter the lowest number of that range into the Translate To, top Port Range box. Then enter the highest number of that range into the bottom Port Range box. When you are finished, click the Add button.

Click the Apply button near the top of the page.

Use the Device box to choose a computer to forward ports to. This box contains a list of computer names that are visible on your network. Select the application you created using the Game or Application drop down box. Then click Add to enable it.

And that is it! You are done![/quote]

Read full topic
item.source: Help me plz! With portforwarding [read plz]

item.title: Help me plz! With portforwarding [read plz]
item.dc:creator: @Darque_Star Darque Star
item.description:
@Darque_Star wrote:

Open a web browser like internet explorer or Netscape. Enter the ip address of your router in the address bar of your browser. In the picture above the address bar has http://www.google.com in it. Just replace all of that with the ip address of your router. By default the ip address should be set to 192.168.1.254.

You should see a box prompting you for your username and password. Enter your username and password now. By default both the username and password are admin. Click the Ok button to log in to your router.

Click the Advanced link near the left side of the page.

Click the Continue to Advanced link near the center of the page.

The menu on the left should change. In this new menu, click Application Sharing.

Click the click here link near the center of the page.

Enter the name of the program into the Name box. It doesn’t really matter what you put into this box, but something that will remind you why these ports are being forwarded would be a good idea. Put a dot into the Manual Entry of Port Maps radio button. Click the Next button.

Use the Protocol drop down box to select the protocol type of the ports you are forwarding. If you are forwarding a single port, enter that port number into the Translate To, top Port Range and the bottom Port Range boxes. If you are forwarding a range of ports, enter the lowest number of that range into the Translate To, top Port Range box. Then enter the highest number of that range into the bottom Port Range box. When you are finished, click the Add button.

Click the Apply button near the top of the page.

Use the Device box to choose a computer to forward ports to. This box contains a list of computer names that are visible on your network. Select the application you created using the Game or Application drop down box. Then click Add to enable it.

And that is it! You are done!

Read full topic

item.title: Help me plz! With portforwarding [read plz]
item.dc:creator: @Darque_Star Darque Star
item.description:
@Darque_Star wrote:

well you dont have to do anything more, you have triggered AND forwarded the port (43594) WHICH IS the default port for runescape private servers, you can create another application that includes UDP if you really want to. thats what i did, and my private server works perfectly.

Read full topic

item.title: Help me plz! With portforwarding [read plz]
item.dc:creator: @Darque_Star Darque Star
item.description:
@Darque_Star wrote:

you can use either UDP or TCP for the protocol so that doesnt matter, the port ranges is 43594-43595 AND trigger port is 43594 trigger protocol is the one that you used in protocol, and translate to, you dont need to put anything in.

Read full topic
